title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 646-9.1 - Purpose, Scope and Applicability
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 646-9.1 - Purpose, Scope and Applicability

State Regulations

Aquatic invasive species (AIS) pose a serious threat to
the waters of Lake George Park and can cause significant detrimental impacts to
the ecology and economy of the Lake George Park. This rule is intended to
prohibit introduction of aquatic invasive species to Lake George and the waters
of the Lake George Park, and to minimize spread of AIS from Lake George to
other waterbodies. This Subpart creates a program whereby trailered vessels are
inspected prior to launch into the waters of the Lake George Park and upon
retrieval from those waters, to help ensure vessels are free from AIS. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
646-9.1

Adopted, New

York State Register February 19, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 7, eff. 5/15/2014

New

York State Register April 27, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 17, eff. 5/1/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
